# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All"

source.6ead7d8b:
import seaborn as sns
from matplotlib import pyplot as plt
source.7108c268:
x=df['race/ethnicity'].value_counts().index
y=df['race/ethnicity'].value_counts()
color=['#ef476f', '#ffd166', '#06d6a0', '#118ab2', '#073b4c']
sns.barplot(x = x,
            y = y,
            data = df,
            palette=color)
plt.style.use("fivethirtyeight")
plt.gcf().set_size_inches(12,6)

source.cb83e647:
df['total']=(df['math score']+df['reading score']+df['writing score'])/3
fig,axes=plt.subplots(1,4,figsize=(25,8))
sns.barplot(data=df,x='race/ethnicity',y='math score', ax = axes[0],ci=None)
axes[0].set_title("Maths Score")
plt.gcf().set_size_inches(12,6)
sns.barplot(data=df,x='race/ethnicity',y='writing score', ax = axes[1],ci=None)
axes[1].set_title("Writing Score")
plt.gcf().set_size_inches(12,6)
sns.barplot(data=df,x='race/ethnicity',y='reading score', ax = axes[2],ci=None)
axes[2].set_title("Reading Score")
plt.gcf().set_size_inches(12,6)
sns.barplot(data=df,x='race/ethnicity',y='total', ax = axes[3],ci=None)
axes[3].set_title("Total Score")
plt.gcf().set_size_inches(16,6)

source.d1ea4c98: # Affect of lunch on the marks of the students
source.7a1c7f12: Students who intake standard food, get better marks and perform well than the students who consume free/reduced food.
source.1ef302ab:
1. As we see from above charts, "Male" scored more marks in maths than female
2. Female scored more marks in reading and writing than male category
source.3c615fc5: As we can observe that, the students who completed the test preparation course scored good grades and perform well.
source.b20ec2b8: The above observation indicates that, 'Group E' performed better in all subjects and 'Group A' performed worst
